attributes.action: Government must release all data about EU migrant National Insurance numbers!
attributes.background: It is revealed that UK ministers (HMRC) are refusing to release data about active National Insurance numbers issued to EU migrants in the UK as they deem it would be "Unhelpful to the EU renegotiation process". This is unacceptable & the data must be released well before the EU In/Out referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Jonathan Portes Director of the National Institute of Economic & Social Research requested this information to help the UK electorate decide which way to vote in the EU In/Out referendum. His request has been denied. This is not in the spirit of fairness & indeed indicates a Government deliberately hiding information from the electorate because they feel it detrimental to their preferred position.
This is a matter of huge public interest!

attributes.action: Make all infant formula packaging plain and display clear health warnings.
attributes.background: According to a recent study published in The Lancet, the U.K. has the lowest breastfeeding rates in the world. Breastfeeding is by far the healthier choice for mother and baby. However, currently health warnings are portrayed as "benefits of breastfeeding" rather than risks of artificial feeding.
attributes.additional_details: Formula companies spend a vast amount of money on making their product attractive to consumers and this aggressive marketing undermines a woman's ability to breastfeed. Switching from breastfeeding to formula puts a greater strain on an already stretched NHS as it increases the risk of diarrhoea, obesity, and ear and lung infections to name but a few. The Lancet states that "from tobacco, to sugar, to formula milk, the most vulnerable suffer when commercial interests collide with public health."

attributes.action: Stop the CCG from cutting NHS funded IVF services in Suffolk.
attributes.background:
Keeping NHS funded IVF services will impact on so many people's lives by allowing them to have the family they've always wanted.
It would be so unfair to take away an opportunity for people to have a family when they cannot conceive themselves.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.hsj.co.uk/hsj-local/commissioners/nhs-ipswich-and-east-suffolk-ccg/more-south-east-ccgs-plan-cuts-to-ivf-services/7008343.fullarticle

attributes.action: Create a UK Register of Arms Brokers
attributes.background:
While many arms brokers work within the law, some unscrupulous brokers are responsible for the illegitimate and illegal trade of weapons, including to terrorist groups and in war zones. 

A Register of Arms Brokers would better regulate this trade, and prevent criminals from dealing in weapons.
attributes.additional_details:
Responsible and robust control of the arms trade is one of the most crucial ways to uphold the rule of law and protect civilians across the world from violence and oppression.

As a signatory of the Arms Trade Treaty, the UK is expected to create a Register of Arms Brokers. It allows for greater scrutiny of brokers and is a vetting mechanism to ensure a safe and legitimate trade of weapons.

For more info: 
Amnesty International https://goo.gl/1FGCO8 
Saferworld http://goo.gl/aX6ljP

attributes.action: Scan all dogs entering England, Scotland and Wales for microchips
attributes.background: There is an illegal trade in puppies which are kept in inhumane conditions in Ireland.Dogs can be taken across the border from Ireland to Northern Ireland and avoid any Pet Passport control.Microchip scanning on entry into England, Scotland and Wales at entry terminals would control this trade
attributes.additional_details: "Panorama" BBC "Britain's Puppy Dealers Exposed" 16/05/2016

attributes.action: WOMENS EQUALITY -PCOS sufferers deserve hair removal treatment on the NHS
attributes.background: As a woman with PCOS I suffer the effects of hair growth all over my body and face. It is embarrassing and degrading that as a woman I cannot feel feminine yet men are afforded the funding to be female and females are funded for treatments to be male. I deserve the same opportunities as do others.
attributes.additional_details: The nice guidelines do not warrant funding for hair removal treatments like electrolysis and laser treatments. The management of PCOS is not straight forward and generally becomes a weight related issue, however losing weight is difficult for women who have to suffer with PCOS due to the insulin resistant hormones and imbalances. More research needs to be done and this should be an equality right due to the nature of such a condition that removes a woman's ability to feel feminine in society.

attributes.action: Hold an urgent referendum to change voting to Proportional Representation.
attributes.background: The EU referendum has demonstrated that our current democratic system doesn't work. But it has proved that people want more of a voice. We urge a referendum on electoral reform so that our elected representatives actually represent us; we advocate Proportional Representation as the solution.

attributes.action: Call EU suplementary Referendum for UK permanent residents without UKcitizenship
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the Westminster Parliament to implement the law on which basis all residents who have lived in the UK five years or longer should be allowed to vote in referendums. We call furthemore upon HM Government to call suplementary EU Referendum for this unrepresented residents.
attributes.additional_details: According to Office for National Statistics the latest release in 2014  estimate figure was 64.6 milions overall population in UK. Overview of the UK population from February 2016 showed that estimated population in mid-year of 2016 should be 65.52 milions. The population eligible to vote in last EU referendum in UK was 46.50 milions and that mean that about 20 milions (one third of all UK population) in June 2016 was efectively prevented from exercising their universal human right to vote.

attributes.action: Stop HS2! Spend the money on the NHS
attributes.background: We need to scrap this project and reinvest the money in the NHS. Either that or refurbish the existing transport network. Save our tax money! Save our countryside! Save our towns and villages! Save our community's! And Save our homes!

attributes.action: Allow British Syrian professionals to sponsor a family member to live in the UK
attributes.background: We as professional Syrians in the UK are struggling without being able to bring a family member from a war zone and sponsor them to live in the UK, while others come illegally and enjoy the privileges of living in the UK.

attributes.action: All local council authorities must include childminders in free childcare scheme
attributes.background: Currently, it is not compulsory for local authorities to include childminders in any free hours childcare initiative. This is un-balanced and biased. Many parents prefer childminders as an alternative, for some, they need the flexibility. Childminders have to adhere to the same practices and rules.
attributes.additional_details: scma and care inspectorate sites will provide evidence of legislation and training.

attributes.action: SDR operation to be made available on the NHS for all children who need it.
attributes.background: Tommie was born at 30 weeks, and suffers with cerebral palsy  recently he was assed by a team at great Ormond street and was told he was eligible for an SDR op which is his only chance at walking independently however NHS wont fund it meaning its down to family/friends to find £25,000.00
attributes.additional_details: To get out of his wheel chair , Tommie needs to raise £25,000.00 shockingly other families have had to raise much more to help there children walk.

attributes.action: Ban the SoS for Health working for a health company for 10yrs after end of term.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State's primary concern should be the nation's health. A potential conflict of interest arises when policy framed by the Secretary of State could affect his future employment. The revolving door between Whitehall and the private sector should be closed with a 10 year waiting period.
attributes.additional_details:
The previous Health Secretary Andrew Lansley put in place the Health and Social Care Act - opening up health to the private sector - and the Cancer Drug Fund which heavily benefitted Roche. He went on to be employed by Roche and private equity firms with health 
interests.

In 2010 David Cameron promised to end the revolving door between Whitehall and the private sector. It is time to act on this.

http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2015/nov/16/andrew-lansley-three-more-advisory-jobs-drugs-firm

attributes.action: Recognise Brexit is too costly, cancel and prioritise spending on the NHS
attributes.background: The costs of Brexit will be enormous - a shrunken economy wiping out any savings from leaving the EU with no guarantee after years of tough  and costly renegotiation we will achieve better trade treaties. Accept this now by cancelling Brexit in order to concentrate on saving the NHS and our schools.
attributes.additional_details: The costs of Brexit are increasing day by day. Thousands of expensive civil servants will be needed to renegotiate forty years of EU legislation and treaties with no guarantee that there will be improvement for any section of the population. Millions of EU and UK citizens abroad are living in uncertainty as to their futures while attention and resources are diverted from solving the crises in education and the NHS. Cancel Brexit and divert the resources saved to the NHS and our schools.

attributes.action: Review a sentence handed down to a convicted paedophile
attributes.background: Adrian was found with a vast amount of child pornography  he was allowed to walk free from court. a few days later he abused 9 year old girl,  he was still spared jail by a very lenient judge. Please help me get justice and a tougher sentence let’s protect our children.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.dailypost.co.uk/news/north-wales-news/nspcc-slams-sentence-given-gwynedd-10837315

attributes.action: Establish an inquiry into Community and District Hospital Services in Devon
attributes.background: Community Hospital beds have been closed across the area and now the Success Regime is consulting on closing all acute services at North Devon District Hospital.  This would leave residents in North Devon and Torridge over 90 minutes away from the nearest A&E.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is being systematically denied the resources it needs to deliver care in rural areas and a full Parliamentary board of Inquiry needs to be established to assess the funding necessary for providing vital services.  Community Hospitals have closed leading to pressure on the District Hospital that is now threatened with being downgraded because of lack of appropriate funding for the NHS.  The level of funding needs to be established but it also needs to be delivered.

attributes.action: Ban Aspartame from all medicines.
attributes.background: Aspartame which has for years been the cheap artificial sweetener across the market from sweets through all kinds of medicines is finally beginning to be recognised as poison for many people. Some do not react to Aspartame, but many people get seriously ill when exposed to it    .
attributes.additional_details:
For some it attacks the immune system, others have linked it to their cancer and many many other serious bodily illnesses and dysfunctions.

There is zero need for this artificial sweetener in our medicines.

Major corporations like PepsiCo are beginning to take the artificial sweetener aspartame out of their products in response to consumer demand. What does the science say about how consuming aspartame could be harming your health?

Ref : http://aspartame.mercola.com/

attributes.action: The BBC board of governors should not be appointed by HM Government.
attributes.background: The BBC board of governors should be independently selected, and not be associated to any political organisation. If the government of the day appoint the board of governors, there is risk of political bias in reporting, damaging to a strong democracy within these isles.

attributes.action: Cut the NHS waiting list for military children when moving.
attributes.background:
My husband is in the military and we found out 2/3 of our children have SEN meaning they need services provided by NHS.

 we waited over a year for services, we finally get seen to then only get posted. We find out this means we go to the bottom of any list! Starting the process all over again.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm calling on the government to bring in a legislation that serving millitary families do NOT go to the bottom of the NHS waiting lists when they move. 
by the time you get the service you NEED you then get a posting order to only start the process again, meaning your at the bottom of the list! Meanwhile it has had a detremental effect in their development.

put something into place to protect them.  Our families already sacrifice so much, yet recive no support in this matter which is needed.

attributes.action: Mandatory whole life sentence for anyone convicted of murdering a child.
attributes.background: Anyone convicted of murdering a child should spend the rest of there life in prison, without the possibility of parole, the recent case involving Kathryn Smith, highlights how pathetic sentencing for these types of crime has become..
attributes.additional_details: As a parent I feel this Country needs tougher sentencing when it come to crimes against children..

attributes.action: make it legal requirement for public broadcasters to show disabled sports on TV
attributes.background: When London won the right to bid the 2012 summer olympics and Paralympics the slogan for the game was launched 'Inspire a Generation' But sadly what seems to have been forgotten is that the olympics and Paralympics only come around every four years and for the matter of a very short time.

attributes.action: Flash glucose monitoring systems to be available on the NHS.
attributes.background:
Flash glucose monitoring system the next best thing to a cgm. 
Flash Glucose Monitoring is a much cheaper and alternative way to check your sugars, insert a sensor into the arm/leg and scan away why prick when you can scan.
attributes.additional_details:
The system does not require fingerstick calibration, so users can dose insulin based on its readings (except for when hypoglycemic, when glucose levels are rapidly changing, or when symptoms don’t match the system’s readings). 

The sensor can be worn for 14 days at a time, and has shown better control and much cheaper then testing with strips.

attributes.action: Stop Evelyn Woods being deported I
attributes.background: Evelyn Woods has lived in Medway 50+ years. Evelyn has had her 3 children born here(unfortunately one past away in 2003) was married and widowed here. This problem came to light when Evelyn got a job,after 3 months was told she couldn't work here and was facing deportation.
attributes.additional_details: Kent online have recently interviews Evelyn and Kelly Tolhurst Mp has been liasioning with the home office.

attributes.action: Increase penalties for minimum wage cheats and more vigorously prosecute them.
attributes.background: The minimum wage is important, not only to the low paid but to all wage earners. Failure to vigorously pursue minimum wage cheats has the effect of depressing wages at every level. It is essential to recognize that forcing workers into false self-employment is a common tactic of cheating employers.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/endlowpayabuse/

attributes.action: Reopen The Security Industry Authority (SIA) Contact Centre
attributes.background: As of the 6th July, The SIA have closed their contact centre in favour of a online application process. Claiming their new self-service website has been designed to provide an easier, more convenient and efficient service but has not lived up to their high expectations.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.facebook.com/thesiauk/

Multiple issues with new self-service website can be seen in the comments of The SIA Facebook page. One of the biggest complaints being unable to receive a response to any issues or queries.

attributes.action: Hold another UK EU referendum in which UK residents can vote alongside Brits
attributes.background: The results of the UK EU referendum does not accurately reflect the wishes of the country and that is because UK residents were not granted a vote.  UK residents deserve to have a voice in the future of their country.
attributes.additional_details:
The Office for National Statistics (ONS) Labour Force Survey estimated in 2015, there are 3.3 million EU citizens residing in the UK.

UK residents have been calling this country home for years.  They work here, pay taxes, have had children here, own property and yet they didn't have a say in the future of what is also their country.  

A new referendum must be held to include their voice.

attributes.action: Visa Settlement Fees to be ABOLISH
attributes.background: Why UK embassies are discriminated Settled people and British citizens' family member with an extremely expensive Visa Settlement Fees while they are living and paying tax as everyone.

attributes.action: Reinstate maintenance grants for English Students in line with rest of UK.
attributes.background:
On checking the Student Finance England details for our daughter - it became apparent that, as we reside in England - we are disproportionately disadvantaged in terms of government support for further education. 
There are no longer non repayable grants available to English residents.
attributes.additional_details:
If you live in Scotland, Ireland or Wales you are entitled to non repayable grants towards your university fees and living costs, in addition to your loans. On a 3 year degree, an English student will be charged £9k study fees and 'may' be eligible for a loan of up to £6905 for living expenses/year - all of which is repayable! 
If you live elsewhere in the uk - you are eligible to receive non-repayable grants in excess of £5000/yr. 
Over a 3yr course this reduces debt by over £15000! Fair?

attributes.action: Give the people of Wales a referendum on independence
attributes.background:
Give the people of Wales a referendum on Welsh independence.

Cynnal refferendwm ar annibyniaeth Cymru.

attributes.action: Pause, plan and review before a decision on Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty.
attributes.background:
1. Wait 4 to 6 months to allow the parties to resolve their internal conflicts.
2. Take steps to address the divisions that the referendum has revealed in our communities.
3. Hold an independent enquiry into allegations of disinformation during the campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
4. Establish a clear plan of what Brexit would entail; for example, movement of people, economic and trading relations, rights at work, environmental legislation and the future of Projects currently receiving EU funding.
5. This plan should be subject to public consultation and democratic process, including the views of 16 and 17 year olds before a final decision is taken about whether to enact Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty.

attributes.action: Stop foreign men using marriage to live in the UK.
attributes.background: Marriage is a loophole in visa constraints. Abolishing the spouse visa would be for the common good, because England is over-crowded and the UK has more young men than young women. It would not prevent women from marrying foreign men because they can live in the husband's country, as is normal.
attributes.additional_details: This loophole for foreign men was closed in 1969 but was re-opened by the next Labour Home Secretary. The Conservatives promised to close the loophole again in their 1979 election manifesto, but did not keep their promise.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of girls' right to education in Somalia.
attributes.background: In Somalia, 95% of the poorest females, age 7-16, have never been to school. Educated women are less likely to die in childbirth, or to have children at an early age, meaning that they are more likely to find work. Education also narrows the gap between men and women, creating more gender equality.
attributes.additional_details:
Information found on the website of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation. 
Further specific information about Somalia on the UNICEF global site.

attributes.action: Get Southern trains contract cancelled in the South East
attributes.background: Tired of the excuses and the prices paid for train services on these routes only to have trains cancelled, constantly late and you cannot even get a refund on days Southern did not even have a train running all day. Let us get Southern's contract cancelled as soon as possible!

attributes.action: Change law to make  Dog Owners responsible for their Dogs that attack Pets
attributes.background: Too many pets are being attacked by out of control dogs and nothing can be done about it as it's not a police matter.
attributes.additional_details: So let's see if we can change the law, as since 1871 the law says a dog on dog attack is not a police matter. This petition is to see if we can get the law changed that  owners of dogs with a history of aggression/attack MUST be on lead or muzzled if level of aggression is high in open/public spaces.

attributes.action: Reinstate the Eighty Five Percentile Rule for setting speed limits.
attributes.background: We used to set speed limits scientifically and sensibly instead of on a totally arbitrary, Nimbyist, green political, subjective basis that we use now. In those days the strap line 'It's a limit for a reason' did have some merit. Now such claims are totally false.
attributes.additional_details:
The abandonment of a scientific method has resulted in blanket speed limit areas where accidents are not happening, speed limits set to please minority local interests, the over-slowing of crucial infrastructure, the prosecution of many perfectly safe drivers by virtue of arbitrary speed limits and a profitable Speeding Industry.  

An arbitrary order: http://driveeastmidlands.blogspot.co.uk/2015/06/and-here-is-basis-of-high-earning.html 

Speed Limit Submission: http://bit.ly/23zqtCC

attributes.action: Make First Aid training a mandatory part of the Driving Licence
attributes.background: 1780 people died in road accidents in the last 12 months, 23,700 were seriously injured. 50% of deaths occur within 4 minutes of an accident before an ambulance has arrived. Mandatory training as part of the driving test would empower more people with skills to help and save hundreds of lives.
attributes.additional_details: Switzerland, Germany, Czech Republic, Austria, Slovenia, Hungary and the Baltic States all have mandatory First Aid training as part of their Driving Test and consequently have many more people skilled to help in an emergency. This in turn makes roads safer and empowers more people to be able to administer First Aid generally. In a recent survey from SJA 59% of people in the UK would not know what to do in an emergency, this is a sensible way forward.

attributes.action: Turn Luton into the cannabis capital of the world.
attributes.background: Cannabis, hardly even worth being called a drug. Its ridiculous to find that possesion of a plant can land you jail time or at least a trip to the police station. My proposition is that we turn Luton into a city similar to Amsterdam while keeping the drug illegal for sale in the rest of the country.
attributes.additional_details: This was we can use the huge amounts of profits we will see from Luton to further benefit our poorer parts of the country. Rest assured that the majority of people will still be able to stay away from the drug as it would be confined to coffee shops in Luton. This will be a haven for pot smokers knowing that our government is keeping up with the times and wont have to travel to another country to better their economy with our hard earned cash. A big tourist market for a city with an airport.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on immigration.
attributes.background: Never has there been more of a gap between politicians and the public than on immigration.   Since all parties are terrified of the media and special interest groups on this subject, it must be put to the people in a referendum before further immigrants or asylum seekers are admitted.

attributes.action: Wythenshawe Hospital for M.I.A
attributes.background: Keep Wythenshawe Hospital as the major incident/accident hospital for South Manchester and Manchester International Airport

attributes.action: stop DLA refusing rare disabilities! I.e Perthes Disease
attributes.background: Perthes disease, AKA Legg-Calvé- Perthes is a childhood condition affecting the head of femur in the hip joint & can sometimes cause mobility problems in later life necessitating a Total Hip Replacement. Symptoms include a limp occasional leg length discrepancy & pain in the hip especially at night.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the children are in pain almost every day & some are in casts or they may need surgery involving cutting through the thigh bone and re-angling the bone so that the head sits properly in the socket pinning and plating it.In place ago help the head grow to the correct shape. I am disgusted to hear so many stories of DLA/PIP refusing to recognise this as a disability and turning down children in wheelchairs! This can happen not just once but 4-5 times per child. THIS IS A DISGRACE. Do your research DLA!!

attributes.action: Provide immediately  £1.5m to replace Deerness Bridge on C18 in County Durham
attributes.background:
This bridge is a vital semi rural link for families and businesses in County Durham. It is now unsafe for use as the replacement of this 114 year old bridge was hindered by County Durham Councils lack of strategy and funding
These lack of funds will delay replacement by more than 1 year by DCC
attributes.additional_details:
http://m.durhamadvertiser.co.uk/news/14501015.Anger_over_one_way_system_following_closure_of_Deerness_Bridge/?ref=rss&utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=facebook

Facebook page : Deerness Bridge action group

attributes.action: Make all voting in PEN only
attributes.background: Due to the amount of vote rigging that takes place and petitions silenced, we the people of the UK only demand ALL voting from now will be in PEN only .There has never been a lawful reason not too and voting in pencil has never been justified.
attributes.additional_details: People of the UK are tired and hurt because of the no confidence and lack of support we get from current leaders.Time for change.

attributes.action: Publish risk assessments for hydrocarbon exploration and extraction in the U.K.
attributes.background: Risk assessments for hydrocarbon exploration and extraction (Fracking) should be made available for local authorities and communities thereunder. It is fundamental for everyone to have information about personal safety and health risks associated with neighbouring and close by commercial ventures.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/visibility_of_insurance_policies?nocache=incoming-758982#incoming-758982

attributes.action: Make All Ministers Publish Their Tax Returns
attributes.background: In an interview today the Leader of the Opposition Jeremy Corbyn stated "The public need to have confidence that their representatives in Parliament... are getting their income from honest and open sources".
attributes.additional_details:
The British public deserve to know whether their representatives in  government are matching words with personal action and taking individual responsibility with their finances.

Sign this petition to secure a greater level of transparency and promote the ethical accountability of government ministers.

attributes.action: Amend existing Hate Crime legislation to specifically include disabled people.
attributes.background:
Hate crimes are recorded for disabled people, however the criminal offences detailing hate crime, do not cover disabled people.
Crime & Disorder Act 1998 "Hostility on the grounds of race & religion"
Public Order Act 1986 "Stirring up hatred on the grounds of race, religion & sexual orientation"
attributes.additional_details:
Legislation needs to be clear and precise in its definition of the people targeted by hate crime and in the sentencing of those who commit hate crimes. It is a unique offence and needs to protect all those whose lives are devastated or ended through hatred. 
Disabled people cannot choose not to be disabled. 
Disabled people need the law to be amended to offer them full protection and to serve as a deterrent in sentencing those, motivated by hatred & hostility, who commit targeted offences.

attributes.action: Play an active role in achieving a peaceful resolution to the Kashmir dispute.
attributes.background: The Kashmir dispute has not been resolved for over 7 decades. In recent days, we have seen further Indian atrocities committed against the people of Kashmir leaving many dead. The UK government must play its role in pressuring the Indian government to halt its hostilities and to reach a resolution.
attributes.additional_details:
We petition the UK government to:

1) Pressurise the Indian government to halt its hostilities in Indian occupied Kashmir, against the people of Kashmir.

2) Play an active diplomatic role to reach a peaceful settlement of the Kashmir dispute.

3) Ensure, through diplomacy, that the UN Resolutions regarding a free and fair referendum in Kashmir are enforced. Thus, the people of Kashmir may exercise self-determination once and for all without the influence of any State in/out of the region.

attributes.action: Rename Manchester Victoria railway station Manchester Victoria Wood station.
attributes.background: Victoria Wood was a much loved comedian born and raised in Manchester. Her humour was distinctive to the city and she set her TV series 'Dinner Ladies' there. Following her death in 2016, Manchester Victoria railway station was renamed in her honour for an hour. It should be renamed permanently.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/whats-on/whats-on-news/victoria-station-become-victoria-wood-11404138

attributes.action: Refine the ATC radio traffic act to allow UK listening
attributes.background:
Refine the ATC radio traffic act to allow UK listening
Current law states you can only listen to transmissions meant for general reception. This means the general public can not listen to ATC traffic in the UK (but can listen to ATC in the US!).
attributes.additional_details:
A licence is not required for a radio receiver as long as it is not capable of transmission as well (The Wireless Telegraphy Apparatus (Receivers) (Exemption) Regulations 1989 (SI 1989 No 123).

Although it is not illegal to sell, buy or own a scanning or other receiver in the UK, it must only be used to listen to transmissions meant for GENERAL RECEPTION. 
It is an offence to listen to any other radio services unless you are authorised by a designated person to do so.

attributes.action: Change the questions on pip benefit to cover mental health illness
attributes.background: People who have mental health issues getting refused pip because the questions are set for physical health and not mental health

attributes.action: Launch a Parliamentary enquiry into the Whirlpool Tumble Dryer recall
attributes.background: Last year Whirlpool announced a recall of 5 million Tumble Dryers to resolve the risk of a fire.  Their Customer Service dept has been overwhelmed.  The wait for the fix is now 11 months during this the advice from is to continue to use the appliance but not unattended.  Fires are happening.
